titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Felix Vladimirovich Volkhovskiĭ papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-11-08T11:54-0800

change.item: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Felix Vladimirovich Volkhovskii Papers)//EN" "volkhovs.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, photographs, periodicals, and clippings relating to revolutionary movements in Imperial Russia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Felix Vladimirovich Volkhovskii papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1967.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Russian revolutionist and journalist; Socialist Revolutionary Party leader; editor, Free Russia (London).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, photographs, periodicals, and clippings relating to revolutionary movements in Imperial Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 clipping from American press and letter from Helma S. Dudley to Breshkovskaya.

did.unittitle: Various letters and telegrams relating to Burtsev's arrest in England,
Letter, articles and court papers relating to Burtsev's arrest in England,
Gronkovskii, K., ; Beitner, L., ; Kuznetsoff, A.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes by E. Lazarev and S. Krasnopol'skii about Dragomanov's brochure, Nevolia Very.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letter to her sister, I. I. Uspenskii, and letters from unknown persons about creating a common organ, with Plekanov, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes English translation of the manuscript "The Forest Blusters."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of his letter to Tverkoi, May 14, 1896.

did.unittitle: Manuscript of his article, "Istoriia I Russkie Revoliutsionery"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes many letters concerning the publication of Za Narod.

did.unittitle: Lopatin, German, ; Lopatin, Vsevolod, ; Lopatin, N., ; Bart, Bruno (son of G. Lopatin),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 5 letters about Potyomkintsy in Romania.

did.unittitle: Various letters and telegrams relating to his death in 1895
Various letters and newspaper articles relating to his death in 1985
Correspondence between Kropotkin and Volkhovsky re S-K,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letters from Kravchinskii, Fanni; Chaikovskii, N. V.; Krigorino, P.; Krapotkin I, P.; Volkhovsky, F., books and copies; Shishko, L.; Teplov, A. L.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of a letter to Lazarev, copies of 3 letters by Lazarev to Tolstoy, and 1 letter by a Tolstovets (follower), undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes manuscript obituary written by Volkhovsky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes pamphlet on his arrest in Russia, 1908.

did.unittitle: Drafts on "Fund of Free Russian Press,"
Dombrowskii, P., manuscript of his biography
Kaniowsky, J., acknowledgement of a contribution for the benefit of striking workers
Letters of Vigen (Armenian Socialist), ; Pilsudskii, I., ; Filipowicz, T., ; visiting card of Wronski, A. (Jodko),
Izvestiia Oblastnogo Komiteta Zagranichnykh Organizatsii Sotsialistov Revolutsionerov, Paris, Nos. 2 and 6,
Kornev, A., editor of Golos Truda, Kiev,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes manuscript "Doklad Sotsialistov Revolutsionerov" and resolutions.

did.unittitle: Manuscript on the history of the S-R party
Transfer of illegal literature, relating to financing the escape of political prisoners,
Union of Black Sea Fleet, Seamen,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various letters and documents. Includes letters from Anichkin, 1912.

did.unittitle: Society of Friends of Russian Freedom,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes portraits of Mr. and Mrs. Kennan and photograph of their cottage.

did.unittitle: Manuscript of a history of the Society of Friends of Russian Freedom in London, and other notes
Material on the history of the Fund
Freies Russland (German edition of Free Russia),
Society of Popular Lectures in Eastland, London,
Kapital Sel'skikh Bezplatnyk Bibliotek v Sibiri
Volkhovsky, F., At the Mercy of Every Official
Shishko, Chego khochet dobit'sia pravitel'stvo zakonom 9 noiabria
Gonenia na Dukhobortsev s zakliucheniem grafa L. Tolstogo
Koe-chto o Nashikh zadachakh, Po Voennym Voprosam
Pis'ma T. G. Shevchenka k B. Zaleskomu M. T. Simonov (Nomis) Rasskasy
Narodovolets: Numbers 1 -3 (2 copies of issue no. 3)
Correspondence on transportation of illegal literature to Russia,
Various correspondence with the Fund of Free Russian Press,
Letters to Volkhovsky from his daughter Vera,
Letters from F. Volkhovsky to his daughter Vera
Admissions card to Basel Socialist Congress, two telegrams regretting F. F. Volkhovsky's being unable to attend Breshkovskaia's 70th birthday in Paris, January 1914 (in French and Russian),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Sketches," 9 pages in English; 4 pages in English and Russian; 2 1/2 pages in Russian; pamphlet At the Mercy of Every Official. Friends of Russian Freedom, London, 1890.

did.unittitle: Correspondence between F. F. Volkhovsky and W. G. Fitzgerald, editor of Strand Magazine,
Proofs of "How a Russian Escaped from Siberia" with correspondence dated November 189(?)
Correspondence between Volkhovsky and Mr. and Mrs. Mallet, and between F. V. and John R. Åström,
Correspondence from Michel Michailovsky (Moscow and Bedford Park),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letter addressed to "Mr. G. George" (i.e., Egor Lazarev), dated October 21, 1895; letter addressed to "Rev. John R. Fleming" (i.e., Mrs. E. L. Voynich), dated October 12, 1894.

did.unittitle: Manuscript drafts of tribute to Nikolai Konstantin Michailovsky (Populist Narodnic Patriarch), and Chaikovsky or Goldenberg on his "Jubilee,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes U.S. passport of Ida Rauh (dated Vienna, August 30, 1906) left to be used by any suitable revolutionary or connection so long as it should not be for terrorist purposes, used by Vera Volkhovsky in 1906; certificate of recommendation, by a solicitor, November 26, 1902; city of Glasgow permit for travel to Russia, June 21, 1893; legal opinion about "false pretences in obtaining a passport" dated May 31, 1895 (includes Foreign Office memorandum, 1901, and legal opinion about marriage of foreigners in U.K.); letter from J. Spiridion of Cardiff relating to false passport application, dated February 8, 1895; letter from T. H. Sanderson of Foreign Office relating to imprisoned British subject Harry Williams of Central News Telgraphic Agency, dated May 29, 1895.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a lock of hair of F. Volkhovsky's hair; F. Volkhovsky's wife's wedding ring (made from iron of political prisoner's leg iron); F. Volkhovsky's key chain; "Sergias" (Stepniak-Kravchinsky's watchguard); piece of a calendar page, October 27; a Soviet commemorative stamp, 1917-1923; and two post office seals.

did.unittitle: Exercise books containing penciled writings by Vera Volkhovsky, with some addition by Felix Volkhovsky ("of one man's life") in Russian
Pocket diaries (in English, with some Russian entries),
Miscellaneous receipts, bills, notes and correspondence (sometimes addressed to Volkhovsky's pseudonyms)
Correspondence from two firms of solicitors (Radford and Frankland, and Rowe and May), relating to alleged slander by Inspector Melville,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inscribed "From a socialist to an American free-thinker and golden-hearted man, as a slight token of esteem. Do not forget us, George Kennan." 16 large pages comprised of autographed copy of F. Volkhovsky's poem "Our Oppressors", Peter and Paul Fortress, 1869; 6 1/2 full pages of print, extracted from the Siberian Gazette; a long manuscript tale (1883); and two poems, "Gold" of 1872 and "Patience" published anonymously 1871 (two pages missing). Apparently not presented to Kennan.
